slides.title: What is AI?
slides.content:
# Smart Machines ü§ñ

Simulation of human intelligence by machines.
- **Narrow AI**: Good at one task (Chess, Face ID). We have this.
- **General AI (AGI)**: Good at everything (Human-level). We don't have this yet.

slides.title: Machine Learning (ML)
slides.content:
# Learning from Data üìö

Instead of programming rules ("If red, stop"), we show data and let computer find rules.
- Training Data $\to$ Model $\to$ Predictions.

slides.title: Supervised Learning
slides.content:
# Teacher Included üë©‚Äçüè´

Training with labeled data.
- Show 1000 pics of cats labeled "Cat".
- Show 1000 pics of dogs labeled "Dog".
- AI learns to distinguish them.

slides.title: Unsupervised Learning
slides.content:
# Exploring üó∫Ô∏è

Training with NO labels.
- Give AI huge pile of data.
- It finds patterns/clusters on its own.
- "These customers buy similar things."

slides.title: Reinforcement Learning
slides.content:
# Pavlov's Dog üêï

Learning by Trial and Error.
- Valid Action = Reward (+1).
- Bad Action = Punishment (-1).
- How AI learns to play video games (Mario) or walk.

slides.title: Neural Networks
slides.content:
# Digital Brain üß†

Inspired by biological neurons.
- Layers of nodes connected by "weights".
- Data flows through layers, getting processed.
- **Deep Learning**: Many, many layers.

slides.title: Backpropagation
slides.content:
# Learning from Mistakes üìâ

The algorithm that trains Neural Nets.
1. Make a guess.
2. Calculate Error (Loss).
3. Go backward through network, adjusting weights to reduce error.

slides.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
slides.content:
# Talking üó£Ô∏è

AI understanding and generating human language.
- Translation (Google Translate).
- Chatbots (ChatGPT).
- Sentiment Analysis.

slides.title: Computer Vision
slides.content:
# Seeing üëÅÔ∏è

AI interpreting images.
- Facial Recognition.
- Self-driving cars seeing stop signs.
- Medical diagnosis from X-Rays.

slides.title: LLMs (Large Language Models)
slides.content:
# Predict the Next Word üîÆ

Models trained on vast text (internet).
- They don't "know" facts, they predict likely continuations.
- "The cat sat on the _____" -> "Mat".

slides.title: Bias and Ethics
slides.content:
# Mirror of Us ü™û

AI learns from data.
- If data is biased (e.g., historical hiring records), AI becomes biased.
- Ethical issue: Facial recognition failing on minorities.

slides.title: Turing Test
slides.content:
# Human or Machine? üïµÔ∏è

Proposed by Alan Turing (1950).
- Can a machine converse well enough to fool a human into thinking it's human?
- Modern AI passes this easily, but is it "thinking"?

slides.title: Generative AI
slides.content:
# Creator üé®

AI creating new content.
- Images (Midjourney).
- Text (GPT).
- Music.
Raises copyright and creativity questions.

slides.title: Robotics and AI
slides.content:
# Body and Brain ü¶æ

Putting the brain (AI) inside a body (Robot).
- Harder than it looks.
- "Moravec's Paradox": Hard stuff (Chess) is easy for AI; Easy stuff (Walking, Folding laundry) is hard.

slides.title: The Singularity
slides.content:
# Explosion üí•

Hypothetical point where AI becomes smarter than humans and improves itself rapidly.
- Could lead to solving all problems OR extinction.

slides.title: Explainability
slides.content:
# Black Box üì¶

We often don't know *why* a Neural Net made a decision.
- "Why did you deny this loan?"
- Important for trust and law.

slides.title: AI Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **ML** finds patterns in data.
- **Neural Nets** power the revolution.
- **GenAI** creates.
- Powerful tool requiring responsible use.
